intro: Reya umbellata, commonly known as the white umbel plant, is a flowering species native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbrella-like arrangement of small white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30-60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Reya umbellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, spicy scent.
